hammer.Name: T1 Splintered Club
hammer.Description: It's already half broken and you are still using it?

hammer.Name: T2 Wooden Mallet
hammer.Description: This should be hammering nails, not skulls.

hammer.Name: T3 Primal Mace
hammer.Description: Rusty old hammer, on the verge of breaking.

hammer.Name: T4 Orcish Bludgeon
hammer.Description: An ancient weapon stolen from marauding orcs residing in hidden lairs.

hammer.Name: T5 Heavy Mace
hammer.Description: Large weapon used long ago to destroy skulls.

hammer.Name: T6 Iron Basher
hammer.Description: Strange rod-like basher. Seems crude and emits a faint smell of druid oils...

hammer.Name: T7 Darkmetal Maul
hammer.Description: Ancient dwarves forged this mighty structure. Dark and deadly.

hammer.Name: T8 Divine Gavel
hammer.Description: It is said that the eyes of the gods follow the wielder, bringing fortune to the valiant and doom to the cowardly.

hammer.Name: T9 Hallowed Hammer
hammer.Description: Holy tool used by druids to make sacrifices to the ancient nature gods.

hammer.Name: T10 Dwarven Maul
hammer.Description: Heavy basher used by dwarven warriors. Made of an unknown metal, dark and heavy.

hammer.Name: T11 Coldforged Gavel
hammer.Description: A mighty hammer forged without heat killing anything it can without mercy.

hammer.Name: T12 Amboss
hammer.Description: Topped with the skull of a slain beast, this weapon inspires terror in all who stand against it.

hammer.Name: T13 Skullshatterer
hammer.Description: Can penetrate your feeble skull quite easily. Or your foes. Probably yours though.

hammer.Name: T14 Benevolence
hammer.Description: Nothing kind about this cruel weapon.

hammer.Name: T15 Hammer of Gaia
hammer.Description: Deadly and uncontrollable, this celestial hammer etches terror in its purest form into those unfortunate ones who have caught sight of it.

hammer.Name: T16 Worldender
hammer.Description: Does it have the power to end worlds? Few can say. If it does, we will not live long enough to learn of it.

hammer.Name: T17 Nightmare
hammer.Description: A mysterious magician soaked many intricate charms into this weapon, bringing ghastly thoughts and dreams to its wielder.

bow.Name: T1 Driftwood Shortbow
bow.Description: Almost lightweight. You can probably find something better around.

bow.Name: T2 Novice Shortbow
bow.Description: You feel less skilled just by holding this in your hands.

bow.Name: T3 Curved Shortbow
bow.Description: This bow is curved to such an extent that it will probably snap at any moment.

bow.Name: T4 Adventurer's Shortbow
bow.Description: Whoever left this on the ground probably didn't meet a nice end.

bow.Name: T5 Long Bow
bow.Description: A more advanced weapon. Quite nice to look at.

bow.Name: T6 Bone Bow
bow.Description: Put together with the bones of... somebody?

bow.Name: T7 Elven Bow
bow.Description: An expert bow of an elegant race.

bow.Name: T8 Ancient Bow
bow.Description: Crude, but effective. Draws its power from the tiny leaf attached to it.

bow.Name: T9 Iron Piercer
bow.Description: Burns away the enemy with the spiciest of red coloring.

bow.Name: T10 Silver Recurve
bow.Description: A bow commonly used by low ranked royal archers. Blends in well with vegetation.

bow.Name: T11 Assassin's Bow
bow.Description: Masterfully crafted by the bandits of the capitals.

bow.Name: T12 Skyfire Warbow
bow.Description: A rare bow used in the greatest of wars. Shooting it makes you feel like the heavens will collapse.

bow.Name: T13 Hellfire Warbow
bow.Description: What is it? Is it ice? The world may never know...

bow.Name: T14 Widowmaker
bow.Description: Kills as beautifully as it looks.

bow.Name: T15 Stormsong
bow.Description: Surrounded by a ghastly aura. The wind blows in the direction you aim it.

bow.Name: T16 Scarebow
bow.Description: So scary that few have the guts to hold it.

bow.Name: T17 Fury
bow.Description: Embedded with a primal rage, your foes tremble at the sight of this weapon. Pew pew is the last thing they will ever hear.

staff.Name: T1 Broken Twig
staff.Description: Weapon forged by the greatest blacksmith of all the land. At least that's what we told little Timmy.

staff.Name: T2 Cracked Stick
staff.Description: Desperate situations call for desperate measures.

staff.Name: T3 Gnarled Broomstick
staff.Description: Scruffy broomstick stolen from a mage. Gnarled and bony.

staff.Name: T4 Oak Stave
staff.Description: A wand cut from the branches of an ancient oak. Infused with deep power.

staff.Name: T5 Mystic Wand
staff.Description: Mystical weapon glowing with a mysterious essence.

staff.Name: T6 Bone Stave
staff.Description: Nothing fancy about this weapon, just the femur of a lich.

staff.Name: T7 Encrusted Rod
staff.Description: Long rod with a shimmering blue gem on its crown.

staff.Name: T8 Imbued Staff
staff.Description: Dark purple staff. Quite mysterious in its making, yet nice to look at.

staff.Name: T9 Emerald Staff
staff.Description: Constructed from emeralds stolen from the mountain dwarves.

staff.Name: T11 Frozen Greatstaff
staff.Description: Eccentric rod with a pale blue stone embedded inside...

staff.Name: T12 Infernal Staff
staff.Description: Constructed by unknown blacksmiths residing in fabled valleys.

staff.Name: T13 Hellfire Greatstaff
staff.Description: Its beauty calls out to you... to kill... to conquer...

staff.Name: T14 Divine Staff
staff.Description: A staff stolen from the angels. They're still hunting for it.

staff.Name: T15 Crystal Core
staff.Description: Crude in its looks, yet mighty at its heart...

staff.Name: T16 Witch's Heart
staff.Description: We are told it's core is from the heart of a witch. No one has found the corpse. Or the staff itself.

staff.Name: T17 Deathweaver
staff.Description: This weapon is so secretive that the few who wield it have killed all that know of it.

sword.Name: T1 Wooden Sword
sword.Description: Name says it all. Careful of the splinters.

sword.Name: T2 Rusty Ironsword
sword.Description: Not much better than a blunt piece of wood in my opinion.

sword.Name: T4 Broadsword
sword.Description: Some knight dropped this. Probably unintentionally.

sword.Name: T5 Longsword
sword.Description: Long? Yes. Deadly? Maybe. Just don't cut yourself.

sword.Name: T6 Gladius
sword.Description: Crudely carved from the bones of an ancient behemoth.

sword.Name: T7 Greatsword
sword.Description: A sword so mighty that few can handle it. It's pretty heavy.

sword.Name: T8 Nullfire Sword
sword.Description: Diabolical curved blade. Even holding it makes you feel its dark essence.

sword.Name: T9 Ghastly Scimitar
sword.Description: A cold-looking blade with a burning hot edge.

sword.Name: T10 Knight's Greatsword
sword.Description: Cylindrical sword stolen from an ancient king. Cutting capability is questionable.

sword.Name: T11 King's Rapier
sword.Description: A blade wielded by only the most skillful knights.

sword.Name: T12 Void Blade
sword.Description: Powerful masterpiece brought from the abysses of the underworld.

sword.Name: T13 Zerstörer
sword.Description: Mysterious pink sword. Engravings say "Mächtig Zerstörer".

sword.Name: T14 Hearteater
sword.Description: Devours living tissue as it plunges its way into the thick muscle of your foes beating heart.

sword.Name: T15 Demonedge
sword.Description: A blade said to be broken in the past and forged anew by the fabled demons of these magnificent lands.

sword.Name: T16 Excalibur
sword.Description: We were told it was pulled from stone. Still can't find the stone.

sword.Name: T17 Harbinger
sword.Description: This weapon brings about the coming of a new age.

armlet.Name: T1 Simple Wristbands
armlet.Description: Cheap leather bands bought by an ambitious farmer.

armlet.Name: T2 Makeshift Armbands
armlet.Description: Skilled hands made an intricate job at making these homemade cuffs.

armlet.Name: T4 Bone Bracelets
armlet.Description: Elegant cuffs made from the tusks of the last mammoth.

armlet.Name: T5 Iron Vambraces
armlet.Description: Heavy on your arms... worth the protection.

armlet.Name: T6 Imbued Bracers
armlet.Description: Dull metal bracer, handy for night time raiding.

armlet.Name: T8 Mirror Armlets
armlet.Description: Blind your foes with a magical shine off a devious magicians mirror...

armlet.Name: T9 Golem Fragments
armlet.Description: The ancient golems left remnants of their passing, which you unscrupulously have decided to wear on your arm.

armlet.Name: T10 Coldforged Bracers
armlet.Description: The deceptively light steel offers chilling protection against sneaky blows.

armlet.Name: T11 Blackstars
armlet.Description: Stars are not often black, yet this fragment has a... deep... deep darkness.

armlet.Name: T12 Mobiuses
armlet.Description: Reforged, lost, found, stolen, hidden for eras without end.

armlet.Name: T13 Guardians
armlet.Description: This item was forged on a full moon when mysterious incantations were heard in the whispers of the dark. Some say that it was Anubis himself speaking with the dead.

armor.Name: T1 Potato Sack
armor.Description: Sack stiff with starch, making you feel dirty and disheveled.

armor.Name: T3 Adventurer's Tunic
armor.Description: Knobbly soft iron tunic, passed on from many generations of adventurers passing over these lands.

armor.Name: T4 Leather Jerkin
armor.Description: This fabric isn't much, but it might stop an arrow or two.

armor.Name: T5 Scaled Chestguard
armor.Description: Hard suit made from scales taken from a mighty dragon that once roamed these lands.

armor.Name: T6 Sky Mail
armor.Description: Rumours say it's made from clouds...

armor.Name: T7 Shadow Cloak
armor.Description: The wearer blends in nicely with the shadows... or so the thieves think.

armor.Name: T8 Runic Halfplate
armor.Description: Forged by unknown magicians, you wear a dark and powerful chestplate.

armor.Name: T9 Hellfire Fullplate
armor.Description: Forged in unknown valleys, it provides protection for your weak, fleshy body.

armor.Name: T11 Deathless
armor.Description: Rumours say that the wearer is immortal. Unfortunately this armour can only be found on corpses of the slain.

boot.Name: T1 Sandals
boot.Description: At least you're wearing something on those feet.

boot.Name: T2 Cloth Footpads
boot.Description: Soles made from cloth, will probably tear after a few hours.

boot.Name: T3 Leather Shoes
boot.Description: The soft leather is said to be stripped off wild boars roaming the eerie woods.

boot.Name: T4 Bone Brogans
boot.Description: Clearly lacking in imagination, the maker made boots from the bones of a very large creature...

boot.Name: T5 Scaled Treads
boot.Description: Mysterious scales cover the outside of your footwear, catching glares in the sun.

boot.Name: T6 Shadow Shoes
boot.Description: A pleasant pattern made to paralyze your foes... wonder if it works.

boot.Name: T7 Wartorn Boots
boot.Description: Taken from war veterans who clearly didn't find enough protection from these greaves.

boot.Name: T8 Imbued Treads
boot.Description: Chunky in its looks, probably very uncomfortable.

boot.Name: T9 Skyswift Boots
boot.Description: Run as quick as the wind... or close to it.

boot.Name: T10 Coldforged Greaves
boot.Description: Icy cold boots forged without heat which allow you to run without stumbling.

boot.Name: T11 Cloudrunners
boot.Description: Some say you can run on clouds with these. The few that have tried have already ascended.

boot.Name: T12 Talaria
boot.Description: Ancient boots rumoured to be stolen from the feet of a messenger god.

boot.Name: T13 Starshards
boot.Description: Stars were always considered to be almighty, now they're yours.

glove.Name: T1 Hand Wraps
glove.Description: Straps of leather covering your feeble hands. Pulling the bowstring is much easier for you now.

glove.Name: T2 Cloth Mitts
glove.Description: Spun yarn from stolen sheep makes these warm gloves a pleasure to wear.

glove.Name: T3 Leather Gloves
glove.Description: Your fingers can barely move in these stiff leather mitts.

glove.Name: T4 Bone Grips
glove.Description: Clicking sounds travel with you as you wear these.

glove.Name: T5 Iron Gauntlets
glove.Description: Soft-iron gloves provide a little more protection, although your hands are cold now.

glove.Name: T6 Imbued Battlefists
glove.Description: Mitts made out of unknown material... it shines...

glove.Name: T7 Wartorn Mitts
glove.Description: Some war general must have dropped these...probably unintentionally too.

glove.Name: T8 Fiery Handguards
glove.Description: Fire is no match for your hands as you wear these emerald mitts.

glove.Name: T9 Empowerment Gloves
glove.Description: Give a false sense of power.

glove.Name: T10 Coldforged Fists
glove.Description: Forged without heat, worn without fear.

glove.Name: T11 Eternals
glove.Description: Gloves sought by warriors for eras on end...at last...it is found.

glove.Name: T12 Phrygians
glove.Description: Rumours say that a touch from these gloves turns your foes into gold...your hand is strangely heavy...

glove.Name: T13 Titans
glove.Description: Gloves so powerful in their nature that the very air shimmers as you wave your hand.

bag.Name: T1 Linen Pouch
bag.Description: Small little purse used by merchant's wives.

bag.Name: T2 Adventurer's Rucksack
bag.Description: The buckle is worth more than the rest of it.

bag.Name: T3 Purpur Duffel
bag.Description: Nice purple rucksack for all your traveling needs.

bag.Name: T4 Elven Saddlebag
bag.Description: Elegant bag used by elven archers on horseback.

bag.Name: T5 Moss Enigma
bag.Description: Woven from threads of lichen, the construction of this bag remains a mystery.
